items.title: Pete Hegseth Claims 'Total Exoneration' After Pentagon Review Reportedly Finds He Shared Sensitive Plans On Signal App, Says 'Case Closed'
items.standfirst: On Wednesday, former Fox News host and the current U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth declared full clearance after a Pentagon investigation reportedly found he shared sensitive Yemen strike information via Signal but did not assess whether it was classified. Pentagon Review Flags Potential…

items.standfirst: The Pentagon watchdog concluded that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth risked endangering American troops and the US mission against Houthi rebels in Yemen when he shared attack plans on the Signal messaging app. The acting Pentagon inspector general’s report said Hegseth violated government policies…

items.title: DoD watchdog finds Hegseth's Signal chat violated regulations, sources say
items.standfirst: The Pentagon watchdog recently completed its report on Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's use of Signal to share details about operations in Yemen.
items.content: The Pentagon watchdog recently completed its report on Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's use of Signal to share details about operations in Yemen.

items.title: Pentagon report concludes Hegseth put troops in danger with Signal chat
items.standfirst: Report says defense secretary violated policies in sharing secret information in March on planned airstrike in YemenA widely awaited Department of Defense report concluded that the defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, violated departmental policies when he shared secret information in a Signal messaging chat in March that included details of a planned airstrike in Yemen against Houthi fighters, said a source familiar with the report.The Signal chat was disclosed after a reporter for the Atlantic was added as a member. It also included JD Vance, the CIA director, John Ratcliffe, and the then-national security adviser, Mike Waltz. The report did not examine the conduct of those officials, since they do not work at the Department of Defense. Continue reading...
items.content: Report says defense secretary violated policies in sharing secret information in March on planned airstrike in YemenA widely awaited Department of Defense report concluded that the defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, violated departmental policies when he shared secret information in a Signal messaging chat in March that included details of a planned airstrike in Yemen against Houthi fighters, said a source familiar with the report.The Signal chat was disclosed after a reporter for the Atlantic was added as a member. It also included JD Vance, the CIA director, John Ratcliffe, and the then-national security adviser, Mike Waltz. The report did not examine the conduct of those officials, since they do not work at the Department of Defense. Continue reading...

items.title: Pentagon watchdog finds Pete Hegseth's Signal chats put troops at risk, sources say
items.standfirst: The Pentagon's internal watchdog determined Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth jeopardized sensitive military information and could have endangered American service members when he shared certain details about U.S. military operations in Yemen in a private Signal group chat earlier this year, sources told CBS News. Charlie D'Agata has more.
items.content: The Pentagon's internal watchdog determined Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth jeopardized sensitive military information and could have endangered American service members when he shared certain details about U.S. military operations in Yemen in a private Signal group chat earlier this year, sources told CBS News. Charlie D'Agata has more.

items.title: Hegseth’s Signal chat put U.S. personnel at risk, Pentagon watchdog finds
items.standfirst: A Pentagon watchdog report has found that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth put U.S. service members at risk when he used the Signal messaging app to discuss a military strike in Yemen earlier this year. His use of Signal came to light when a journalist was accidentally added to a chat that gave…

His use of Signal came to light when a journalist was accidentally added to a chat that gave…

items.title: Former Pentagon official says watchdog's findings on Hegseth are "not surprising"
items.standfirst: Sources say the Pentagon watchdog found Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth could have endangered American service members when he shared military information in a Signal group chat in March. Alex Plitsas, a former Pentagon official, joins "The Daily Report" to discuss.
items.content: Sources say the Pentagon watchdog found Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth could have endangered American service members when he shared military information in a Signal group chat in March. Alex Plitsas, a former Pentagon official, joins "The Daily Report" to discuss.

items.title: Early details on Pentagon watchdog report about Hegseth's Signal use
items.standfirst: Sources tell CBS News that an internal watchdog investigation found Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated policies when he shared sensitive military information in a Signal group chat earlier this year. CBS News' James LaPorta and Weijia Jiang have more.
items.content: Sources tell CBS News that an internal watchdog investigation found Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated policies when he shared sensitive military information in a Signal group chat earlier this year. CBS News' James LaPorta and Weijia Jiang have more.

items.content: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement has been directed by the Trump administration to target undocumented Somali immigrants in the Twin Cities, according to the New York Times.

items.standfirst: A forthcoming inspector general report finds that had intel shared by Hegseth been intercepted by an adversary, it would have endangered servicemembers, according to a source who viewed the findings.
items.content: A forthcoming inspector general report finds that had intel shared by Hegseth been intercepted by an adversary, it would have endangered servicemembers, according to a source who viewed the findings.(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)

items.title: Federal agents launch immigration crackdown in New Orleans
Trump administration begins immigration crackdown in New Orleans
items.standfirst: The Department of Homeland Security on Wednesday formally announced a new immigration enforcement crackdown in New Orleans, dubbed "Catahoula Crunch."
items.content: The Department of Homeland Security on Wednesday formally announced a new immigration enforcement crackdown in New Orleans, dubbed "Catahoula Crunch."

items.title: US Department of Homeland Security launches immigration crackdown in New Orleans
items.standfirst: The US Department of Homeland Security launched a major immigration crackdown in New Orleans on Wednesday, escalating the Trump administration’s campaign in Democratic-run cities and prompting concern from local leaders over the scope, tactics and potential civil rights implications of the operation.
items.content: The US Department of Homeland Security launched a major immigration crackdown in New Orleans on Wednesday, escalating the Trump administration’s campaign in Democratic-run cities and prompting concern from local leaders over the scope, tactics and potential civil rights implications of the operation.

items.title: Trump admin takes aim at New Orleans in latest US immigration crackdown

items.content: Latest surge of federal agents comes as Donald Trump says National Guard will soon be deployed to Louisiana city.

Trump administration is escalating its campaign in Democratic-run cities.
Local leaders expressed concern over the operation's scope and tactics.

clusters.title: Path to peace in Ukraine unclear, says Trump, as US envoys prepare to meet Kyiv official
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine Peace Talks Remain Unclear

items.title: Path to peace in Ukraine unclear, says Trump, as US envoys prepare to meet Kyiv official
items.standfirst: Trump’s comments come after an hours-long meeting at the Kremlin between US envoys and Vladimir Putin failed to achieve a breakthroughAnalysis: the Ukraine peace deal has stumbled yet again over an inevitable obstacle: PutinThe path ahead for Ukraine peace talks is unclear, Donald Trump has said, after what he called “reasonably good” talks between Russian president Vladimir Putin and US envoys which nonetheless failed to achieve a breakthroughAfter their hours-long meeting at the Kremlin on Tuesday, US special envoy Steve Witkoff and Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner, were set to meet top Ukrainian negotiator Rustem Umerov in Florida on Thursday. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump’s comments come after an hours-long meeting at the Kremlin between US envoys and Vladimir Putin failed to achieve a breakthroughAnalysis: the Ukraine peace deal has stumbled yet again over an inevitable obstacle: PutinThe path ahead for Ukraine peace talks is unclear, Donald Trump has said, after what he called “reasonably good” talks between Russian president Vladimir Putin and US envoys which nonetheless failed to achieve a breakthroughAfter their hours-long meeting at the Kremlin on Tuesday, US special envoy Steve Witkoff and Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner, were set to meet top Ukrainian negotiator Rustem Umerov in Florida on Thursday. Continue reading...

items.title: The Ukraine peace deal has stumbled yet again over an inevitable obstacle: Putin
items.standfirst: Russian leader’s rejection of latest peace proposal was predictable and shows the Kremlin continues to hold the trump cardBefore the harsh white glare of the Kremlin reception room came a telling prologue: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump’s self-described “deal guys”, being led by Kremlin officials through the sparkling streets of a festive Moscow.Wasn’t it lovely, Vladimir Putin asked later, as both sides sat down to a five-hour negotiation that seems to have led right back to where they started. “It’s a magnificent city,” Witkoff replied. Then the cameras cut out. Continue reading...
items.content: Russian leader’s rejection of latest peace proposal was predictable and shows the Kremlin continues to hold the trump cardBefore the harsh white glare of the Kremlin reception room came a telling prologue: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump’s self-described “deal guys”, being led by Kremlin officials through the sparkling streets of a festive Moscow.Wasn’t it lovely, Vladimir Putin asked later, as both sides sat down to a five-hour negotiation that seems to have led right back to where they started. “It’s a magnificent city,” Witkoff replied. Then the cameras cut out. Continue reading...

items.title: NATO allies gather in Brussels after inconclusive Ukraine peace talks in Moscow
items.standfirst: Almost all of NATO's foreign ministers gathered in Brussels on Wednesday, a day after inconclusive Ukraine peace talks between the United States and Russian President Vladimir Putin and as European officials struggled for a seat at the negotiating table
items.content: Almost all of NATO's foreign ministers gathered in Brussels on Wednesday, a day after inconclusive Ukraine peace talks between the United States and Russian President Vladimir Putin and as European officials struggled for a seat at the negotiating table

items.content: The BBC's Russia Editor shares his analysis after five hours of peace talks between the Russians and the US.

items.title: No compromise reached on U.S. peace plan for Ukraine

items.content: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, President Donald Trump representatives tasked with negotiating an end to the war in Ukraine, will face Russian President Putin.

items.content: Vladimir Putin has been accused of "wasting the world's time" after rejecting the latest iteration of Donald Trump's peace plan for Ukraine.

items.content: A meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump's envoy lasted five hours but ended without clear progress toward ending the war in Ukraine.

clusters.title: Hunt for missing flight MH370 to resume this month more than a decade after its disappearance
clusters.neutral_headline: Search for Missing Flight MH370 to Resume

items.title: Hunt for missing flight MH370 to resume this month more than a decade after its disappearance
items.standfirst: An American company will conduct another search for missing flight MH370, more than a decade after its disappearance en route to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur. Multiple search operations for the plane have been conducted since the mysterious crash but all proved fruitless. NBC aviation analyst Jeff Guzzetti describes the chances of finding the wreckage.
items.content: An American company will conduct another search for missing flight MH370, more than a decade after its disappearance en route to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur. Multiple search operations for the plane have been conducted since the mysterious crash but all proved fruitless. NBC aviation analyst Jeff Guzzetti describes the chances of finding the wreckage.

items.title: Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 search to resume 11 years after jet went missing
items.standfirst: Malaysian transport ministry says robotics company Ocean Infinity will restart search operation on 30 DecemberThe search for the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 will resume this month, the Malaysian transport ministry has said, more than a decade after the plane disappeared in one of aviation’s greatest mysteries.In a statement on Wednesday, the transport ministry confirmed that the marine robotics company Ocean Infinity, based in the UK and US, would resume a search of the seabed from 30 December, over a period of 55 days, with operations conducted intermittently. Continue reading...
items.content: Malaysian transport ministry says robotics company Ocean Infinity will restart search operation on 30 DecemberThe search for the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 will resume this month, the Malaysian transport ministry has said, more than a decade after the plane disappeared in one of aviation’s greatest mysteries.In a statement on Wednesday, the transport ministry confirmed that the marine robotics company Ocean Infinity, based in the UK and US, would resume a search of the seabed from 30 December, over a period of 55 days, with operations conducted intermittently. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The deep-sea hunt for missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, which vanished more than 11 years ago, will resume this month, Malaysia's transport ministry has said.
items.content: The deep-sea hunt for missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, which vanished more than 11 years ago, will resume this month, Malaysia's transport ministry has said.

items.title: Search for long-missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 to resume
items.standfirst: The Boeing 777 with 239 people on board vanished in 2014 in one of the greatest aviation mysteries.
items.content: The Boeing 777 with 239 people on board vanished in 2014 in one of the greatest aviation mysteries.

ai_summary: Search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 will resume this month.
The plane disappeared more than a decade ago in 2014.
Ocean Infinity will restart the search operation on December 30th.
The search will last for 55 days, conducted intermittently.
The Boeing 777 had 239 people on board when it vanished.

clusters.title: What to know about Minnesota fraud allegations, as Trump levels attacks on Walz

items.title: What to know about Minnesota fraud allegations, as Trump levels attacks on Walz
items.standfirst: President Trump has recently attacked Gov. Tim Walz over the fraud cases, calling Minnesota a "hub of fraudulent money laundering activity" and lashing out against the state's Somali community.
items.content: President Trump has recently attacked Gov. Tim Walz over the fraud cases, calling Minnesota a "hub of fraudulent money laundering activity" and lashing out against the state's Somali community.

items.title: How Minnesota became a hub for Somali immigrants in the U.S.
items.standfirst: Minnesota boasts the largest population of Somalis in the U.S. — a community that's recently faced attacks from President Trump. Here's a brief history of how they came to settle there.
items.content: Minnesota boasts the largest population of Somalis in the U.S. — a community that's recently faced attacks from President Trump. Here's a brief history of how they came to settle there.(Image credit: Jessie Wardarski)

items.title: Minneapolis immigration operation targeting mostly Somali immigrants begins, officials say
items.standfirst: An immigration operation in Minneapolis has begun, targeting mostly Somali immigrants, officials say. President Trump has repeatedly attacked Minnesota's Somali population, saying, "I don't want them in our country." 95% of the roughly 80,000 Somalis in Minnesota are U.S. citizens. CBS News' Camilo Montoya-Galvez reports.
items.content: An immigration operation in Minneapolis has begun, targeting mostly Somali immigrants, officials say. President Trump has repeatedly attacked Minnesota's Somali population, saying, "I don't want them in our country." 95% of the roughly 80,000 Somalis in Minnesota are U.S. citizens. CBS News' Camilo Montoya-Galvez reports.

clusters.title: Macron meets Xi in Beijing as he urges China to push for Ukraine ceasefire
clusters.neutral_headline: Macron Meets Xi in Beijing

items.title: Macron meets Xi in Beijing as he urges China to push for Ukraine ceasefire
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron arrived in Beijing on Thursday for high-stakes talks with Xi Jinping, aiming to persuade China to use its influence with Moscow to help secure a ceasefire in Ukraine while also tackling deepening trade tensions between Europe and the world’s second-largest economy.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron arrived in Beijing on Thursday for high-stakes talks with Xi Jinping, aiming to persuade China to use its influence with Moscow to help secure a ceasefire in Ukraine while also tackling deepening trade tensions between Europe and the world’s second-largest economy.

items.title: Macron meets Xi as France navigates EU's China de-risking strategy
items.standfirst: TOKYO -- Chinese President Xi Jinping welcomed visiting French President Emmanuel Macron to the capital on Thursday, as the European Union's second-largest economy attempts to balance its ties with Beijing and the bloc's broader de-risking strategy. Trade imbalances, Ukraine war and Taiwan…
items.content: TOKYO -- Chinese President Xi Jinping welcomed visiting French President Emmanuel Macron to the capital on Thursday, as the European Union's second-largest economy attempts to balance its ties with Beijing and the bloc's broader de-risking strategy. Trade imbalances, Ukraine war and Taiwan…

items.title: Macron to meet Xi as France navigates EU's China de-risking strategy
items.standfirst: TOKYO -- French President Emmanuel Macron is set to meet his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, on Thursday, as the European Union's second-largest economy attempts to balance its ties with Beijing and the bloc's broader de-risking strategy. Trade imbalances, Ukraine war and Taiwan tensions loom…
items.content: TOKYO -- French President Emmanuel Macron is set to meet his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, on Thursday, as the European Union's second-largest economy attempts to balance its ties with Beijing and the bloc's broader de-risking strategy. Trade imbalances, Ukraine war and Taiwan tensions loom…

items.title: Macron arrives in China for talks with Xi on trade ties and Russia's war in Ukraine
items.standfirst: Emmanuel Macron arrived in China on Wednesday for a three-day state visit focusing on trade and diplomatic talks as the French president seeks to enlist Beijing in pressuring Russia toward a ceasefire with Ukraine. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Jean-François Di Meglio, Economist and President of the Asia Centre think tank. He says that the French President will likely prioritise discussions on global governance, insisting on Xi's participation in next year's G7 summit in France.
items.content: Emmanuel Macron arrived in China on Wednesday for a three-day state visit focusing on trade and diplomatic talks as the French president seeks to enlist Beijing in pressuring Russia toward a ceasefire with Ukraine. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Jean-François Di Meglio, Economist and President of the Asia Centre think tank. He says that the French President will likely prioritise discussions on global governance, insisting on Xi's participation in next year's G7 summit in France.

ai_summary: Macron met with Xi Jinping in Beijing.
Macron aims to persuade China to push for a Ukraine ceasefire.
Macron is navigating the EU's China de-risking strategy.
Trade imbalances, Ukraine war, and Taiwan tensions loom.
Macron is on a three-day state visit to China.

items.title: Tech Left Behind in S&P 500’s Latest Rebound | Bloomberg Tech 12/3/2025
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde digs into anxieties and losses coming from the Magnificent 7 as big tech stocks lag the wider market. Plus, Okta CEO Todd McKinnon discusses the software maker’s earnings as the company boosts its full year profit forecast. And TikTok plans to invest more than $37 billion to build its first Latin American data center in Brazil. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde digs into anxieties and losses coming from the Magnificent 7 as big tech stocks lag the wider market. items.title: Pentagon knew boat attack left survivors but still launched follow-up strike, AP sources say
items.standfirst: The additional information comes as Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth is under growing scrutiny over the department’s strikes on alleged drug traffickers in the Caribbean and Pacific, and in particular the early September follow-on strike that reportedly killed survivors.
items.content: The additional information comes as Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth is under growing scrutiny over the department’s strikes on alleged drug traffickers in the Caribbean and Pacific, and in particular the early September follow-on strike that reportedly killed survivors.

items.title: Licence to kill?
items.standfirst: When should a soldier disobey an order? The US president and his Pentagon chief doubling down on operations to sink without summation alleged drug boats in the Carribean and the Pacific, the pair pushing back on a Washington Post report asserting that back in September, Pete Hegseth's orders led to a follow-up strike on a vessel, killing all remaining survivors. Among the issues whether interested parties could face war crimes charges.
items.content: When should a soldier disobey an order? The US president and his Pentagon chief doubling down on operations to sink without summation alleged drug boats in the Carribean and the Pacific, the pair pushing back on a Washington Post report asserting that back in September, Pete Hegseth's orders led to a follow-up strike on a vessel, killing all remaining survivors. Among the issues whether interested parties could face war crimes charges.

ai_summary: Rand Paul expressed outrage at being misled by Pete Hegseth.
Hegseth is the current U.S. Defense Secretary.
Paul was misled about strikes on alleged drug traffickers.
The Pentagon knew of survivors but launched a follow-up strike.

items.title: Stocks Rise as Soft ADP Report Boosts Rate-Cut Hopes | The Close 12/3/2025
items.standfirst: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Rothschild & Co’s Alex Haissl, Goldman Sachs’ Alexandra Wilson-Elizondo, MorningStar’s David Swartz, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s Rohit Chopra, GenTrust’s Elena Hernandez, Apollo’s David Sambur, Wedbush Securities’s Dan Ives, Bain & Company’s Leah Johns, Morgan Stanley Private Wealth Management’s Chris Toomey, Raising Cane's Todd Graves. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Rothschild & Co’s Alex Haissl, Goldman Sachs’ Alexandra Wilson-Elizondo, MorningStar’s David Swartz, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau’s Rohit Chopra, GenTrust’s Elena Hernandez, Apollo’s David Sambur, Wedbush Securities’s Dan Ives, Bain & Company’s Leah Johns, Morgan Stanley Private Wealth Management’s Chris Toomey, Raising Cane's Todd Graves. (Source: Bloomberg)

clusters.title: Doctor jailed for supplying 'Friends' star Matthew Perry with ketamine
clusters.neutral_headline: Doctor jailed for supplying 'Friends' star Matthew Perry with ketamine

items.title: Doctor jailed for supplying 'Friends' star Matthew Perry with ketamine
items.standfirst: A California physician who sold ketamine at steep markups to "Friends" star Matthew Perry in the weeks before the actor’s fatal overdose was sentenced to prison on Wednesday. The case marks the first sentencing in the criminal probe into Perry’s 2023 death, which investigators say involved a network of suppliers who fuelled the actor’s addiction.
items.content: A California physician who sold ketamine at steep markups to "Friends" star Matthew Perry in the weeks before the actor’s fatal overdose was sentenced to prison on Wednesday. The case marks the first sentencing in the criminal probe into Perry’s 2023 death, which investigators say involved a network of suppliers who fuelled the actor’s addiction.

items.title: 'No excuse' - California doctor sentenced to 30 months in Matthew Perry overdose case
items.standfirst: Dr Salvador Plasencia is the first of five people to be sentenced in the Friends star's overdose death.
items.content: Dr Salvador Plasencia is the first of five people to be sentenced in the Friends star's overdose death.

ai_summary: A doctor was sentenced to prison for supplying ketamine.
The ketamine was sold to Matthew Perry before his death.
The case is part of a probe into Perry's overdose.
The doctor sold ketamine at inflated prices.
The investigation involves multiple suppliers.

items.title: What was Honduras ex-president convicted of and why has Trump pardoned him?
items.standfirst: Juan Orlando Hernández, once called the key figure in a drug trafficking scheme that flooded America with cocaine, walked free after the pardon.
items.content: Juan Orlando Hernández, once called the key figure in a drug trafficking scheme that flooded America with cocaine, walked free after the pardon.

items.title: Trump frees ex-Honduran president from prison as country awaits knife-edge election result
items.standfirst: Release of convicted cocaine trafficker Juan Orlando Hernández is latest US interference in election and comes despite Trump’s apparent ‘war on drugs’Analysis: Trump’s pardon of Honduras’s ex-president shows counter-drug effort is ‘based on lies and hypocrisy’A former president of Honduras who was convicted of drug trafficking has walked free from a US prison after receiving a pardon from Donald Trump, as the country’s presidential election remained on a knife edge with the US-backed candidate leading by 515 votes.Juan Orlando Hernández, who was sentenced to 45 years in prison for allegedly creating “a cocaine superhighway to the United States”, was released from a West Virginia prison after Trump’s intervention, Hernández’s wife confirmed on Tuesday. Continue reading...
items.content: Release of convicted cocaine trafficker Juan Orlando Hernández is latest US interference in election and comes despite Trump’s apparent ‘war on drugs’Analysis: Trump’s pardon of Honduras’s ex-president shows counter-drug effort is ‘based on lies and hypocrisy’A former president of Honduras who was convicted of drug trafficking has walked free from a US prison after receiving a pardon from Donald Trump, as the country’s presidential election remained on a knife edge with the US-backed candidate leading by 515 votes.Juan Orlando Hernández, who was sentenced to 45 years in prison for allegedly creating “a cocaine superhighway to the United States”, was released from a West Virginia prison after Trump’s intervention, Hernández’s wife confirmed on Tuesday. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Juan Orlando Hernández was convicted of drug trafficking.
Trump pardoned the former Honduran president.
Hernández was sentenced to 45 years in prison.
He was accused of creating a "cocaine superhighway".
The pardon occurred after his conviction.
